IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ASSOCIATION OF CATHOLIC COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, FOUNDED IN 1899, SERVES AS THE COLLECTIVE VOICE OF U.S CATHOLIC HIGHER EDUCATION. THROUGH PROGRAMS AND SERVICES, THE ASSOCIATION STRENGTHENS AND PROMPTES THE CATHOLIC IDENTITY AND MISSION OF ITS MEMBER INSTITUTIONS SO THAT ALL ASSOCIATED WITH CATHOLIC HIGHER EDUCATION CAN CONTRIBUTE TO THE GREATER GOOD OF THE WORLD AND THE CHURCH.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ASSOCIATION OF CATHOLIC COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, FOUNDED IN 1899, SERVES AS THE COLLECTIVE VOICE OF U.S CATHOLIC HIGHER EDUCATION. THROUGH PROGRAMS AND SERVICES, THE ASSOCIATION STRENGTHENS AND PROMPTES THE CATHOLIC IDENTITY AND MISSION OF ITS MEMBER INSTITUTIONS SO THAT ALL ASSOCIATED WITH CATHOLIC HIGHER EDUCATION CAN CONTRIBUTE TO THE GREATER GOOD OF THE WORLD AND THE CHURCH.
IRS990.Desc: ANNUAL MEETING: ANNUAL MEETING IN WASHINGTON DC BRINGING TOGETHER REPRESENTATIVES FROM MEMBER INSTITUTIONS TO DISCUSS HIGHER EDUCATION, INVESTMENTS, STRATEGIC PLANNING, AND OTHER EDUCATION THEMES AND ISSUES. THOSE ATTENDING ARE THE PRESIDENTS AND SENIOR ADMINISTRATORS FROM MEMBER INSTITUTIONS.OTHER PROGRAMS/CONFERENCES: ACCU HOSTS AND COHOSTS NUMEROUS SEMINARS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR WHICH COVER VARIOUS TOPICS RELATED TO EDUCATIONAL ISSUES: E.G., ROME SEMINAR; MISSION OFFICER CONFERENCE; PEACE & JUSTICE CONFERENCE; NEW PRESIDENTS INSTITUTE; AND OTHERS AS NEEDED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ADVISORY SERVICES (MEMBERSHIP) : ACCU PROVIDES LEADERSHIP CONSULTATION, RESEARCH SUPPORT, AND ADVISORY SERVICES TO MEMBER INSTITUTIONS, CHURCH ORGANIZATIONS, OTHER EDUCATIONAL ASSOCIATIONS, RESEARCHERS, AND THE PUBLIC MEDIA.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PUBLICATIONS: A SEMI-ANNUAL PUBLICATION COVERING HIGHER EDUCATION ISSUES AND AN ELECTRONIC QUARTERLY UPDATES/NEWSLETTER THAT ARE SENT TO MEMBER INSTITUTIONS AND THOSE WHO REQUEST THE PUBLICATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION FOLLOWS THE GUIDANCE OF ASC 740-10, "ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES" WHICH CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR THE RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF THE BENEFITS OF INDIVIDUAL TAX POSITIONS IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, INCLUDING THOSE OF NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. TAX POSITIONS MUST MEET A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT IN ORDER FOR THE BENEFIT OF THOSE TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE ASSOCIATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ASSOCIATION ANALYZES TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, INCLUDING THOSE RELATED TO THE REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN IRC SEC. 501(C) TO QUALIFY AS A TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATION, ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY VOLUNTEERS AND BOARD MEMBERS, THE REPORTING OF UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, AND ITS STATUS AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER MARYLAND STATE STATUTE. THE ASSOCIATION DOES NOT KNOW OF ANY TAX BENEFITS ARISING FROM UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND THERE WAS NO EFFECT ON THE ASSOCIATION'S FINANCIAL POSITION OR CHANGES IN NET ASSETS AS A RESULT OF ANALYZING ITS TAX POSITIONS. FISCAL YEARS ENDING ON OR AFTER JUNE 30, 2015 REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL AND STATE AUTHORITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ACCU UPDATED ITS BYLAWS IN FY18: ACCU UPDATED AND APPROVED THE FOLLOWING GOVERNANCE POLICIES- LIQUIDITY POLICY AND MEMBERSHIP POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ACCU SERVES AN INSTITUTIONAL MEMBERSHIP COMPRISED OF REGIONALLY ACCREDITED CATHOLIC COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, EACH WITH ITS PRINCIPAL OFFICE LOCATED IN THE UNITED STATES. INSTITUTIONAL MEMBERSHIP IS VOLUNTARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FULL MEMBERS ARE ENTITLED TO VOTE FOR OR AGAINST THE SLATE OF NOMINEES SUBMITTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN CONNECTION WITH THE ANNUAL ELECTION FOR VACANT SEATS ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FULL MEMBERS ARE ENTITLED TO VOTE FOR OR AGAINST ANY PROPOSED AMENDMENTS TO THE BYLAWS OR ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 FORM WAS PREPARED BY THE OUTSIDE ACCOUNTANTS AND REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT AND DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS. A COPY OF THE 990 WAS SENT BY EMAIL TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A CONFLICT OF INTEREST AGREEMENT IS SIGNED ANNUALLY BY EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS. ANY CONFLICT OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST ON THE PART OF ANY DIRECTOR OR OFFICER IS DISCLOSED BY THAT PERSON TO THE CHAIR OR VICE-CHAIR OF THE BOARD AT OR PRIOR TO THE TIME SUCH A MATTER IS UNDER CONSIDERATION BY THE BOARD OR ANY OF ITS COMMITTEES. NO DIRECTOR OR OFFICER VOTES ON ANY MATTER IN WHICH THAT PERSON HAS A CONFLICT OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT IS SET BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, PER BYLAWS, ART. IV, SECTION 1(A). COMPENSATION DECISIONS ARE BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF PERFORMANCE AND EXTERNAL DATA REGARDING COMPARABLE COMPENSATION FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS. THE PRINCIPAL COMPENSATION BENCHMARKS USED ARE NATIONAL DATA FOR HIGHER EDUCATION ASSOCIATION EXECUTIVES IN THE WASHINGTON, DC, AREA (PROVIDED ANNUALLY BY QUATT ASSOCIATES). DECISIONS ARE RECORDED IN THE FORM OF A LETTER FROM THE BOARD CHAIR TO THE PRESIDENT, WITH A COPY ON FILE AT ACCU. THE LAST COMPENSATION REVIEW FOR THE PRESIDENT WAS ON JUNE 7, 2016. COMPENSATION OF ACCU'S OTHER EMPLOYEES, WHO ARE FEW IN NUMBER, IS DETERMINED BY THE PRESIDENT BASED ON PERFORMANCE AND, WHEN AVAILABLE FOR A GIVEN POSITION, ON EXTERNAL BENCHMARKS PROVIDED BY THE SAME SOURCES NAMED ABOVE OR OTHER SIMILAR SOURCES. COMPENSATION BUDGETS AND PROPOSED CHANGES TO COMPENSATION POLICIES AND BENEFIT PLANS ARE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
THE ASSOCIATION'S OVERSIGHT PROCESS AND INDEPENDANT AUDITOR SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED DURING THE CURRENT YEAR.
